This is an example of misinterpretation of the consultant's answers. I was wondering whether the tone sequence was LMHL or LMHM. I wanted to test the hypothesis that it was LMHM and not LMHL. I did so by producing the phrase in what I intended as a very clear (unambiguous) LMHL sequence, and asking for the consultant's judgment on this. Her judgment was negative, and this led me to adopt a transcription as LMHM at that time. Later I realized that her judgment was in fact not due to the fundamental frequency at which I produced this token: it was due to the exceedingly slow speech rate. The repetition which she produces immediately after formulating her negative judgment is in fact a clear instance of MLHL, with a final L target.
Input tones (separated by a space): LM+#H L
This sequence is a verification of the identity of the tone patterns of the two phrases.
